page.title: 03Houses
page.content: The houses in this block are made of{ {limestone}and{sandstone.}Some were built in seventeenth century, most were built in 18C and 19C, a few were built in 20C. There are{cottages,}small{farm {houses,}and some bigger farm houses. Nearly all the houses and cottages belong to the Estate. The{oldest house}is probably Riddings Cottage. All the houses and cottages have been modernized, some in the 1970s. Bolton{Hall,}the Priory Gate House extended in 18C and 19C, is used as a hunting lodge by the Duke of Devonshire and his guests in August for the grouse shoot.
